info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 2:20PM MST until January 06 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting around 40 mph. Blowing and drifting snow is expected. * WHERE...Inkom, McCammon, Downey, Lava Hot Springs, Malad, Preston, Thatcher, St. Charles, Montpelier, Georgetown, Grace, Soda Springs, Henry, and Bone. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST Thursday. Winds and snow are tapering off from this last system but winds are still elevated especially in our southern areas. The bigger impacts reoccur when snow starts again after midnight with the next wave of moisture. Higher snow amounts will mostly be up high. Wind impacts will start again late Thursday morning into the afternoon when the winds pick back up with gusts of around 30 mph with mountain tops gusts of around 40 mph. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and hazardous road conditions. Patchy blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute and possibly the evening commute. Gusty winds could cause blowing and drifting of snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
